title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers confirms he requested a trade from the Raiders due to unsatisfactory contract negotiations but remains 'happy to be a Raider'.
Meyers, former Patriots receiver, caught eight passes for 97 yards in Las Vegas' 20-13 win against New England.
The Patriots have undergone significant changes, including new head coach Mike Vrabel, since Meyers' departure after the 2023 season.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A radar-confirmed tornado touched down near Worcester, Massachusetts during a storm, with damage reported in Holden.
The National Weather Service will conduct a damage survey in Holden on Monday to assess the tornado's impact.
Severe thunderstorm watches covered much of the East Coast, affecting states from Maryland to Maine, including Massachusetts.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots lost 20-13 to the Las Vegas Raiders in their 2025 season opener.
Quarterback Drake Maye showed promise in the first half but struggled after an interception in the second half.
The Patriots' defense, despite new talent like Harold Landry III, allowed 362 passing yards to Raiders QB Geno Smith.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell struggled late in his NFL debut with two false starts and involvement in two sacks.
Campbell acknowledged mistakes, vowing to improve his timing and block execution after the Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Mike Vrabel noted the need for team-wide improvement, citing inconsistency in all phases during the Patriots' defeat.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Lynn officer placed on leave after video shows him incapacitated during a traffic stop, sparking investigation.
Video depicts officer unresponsive, blinking slowly, struggling to stand; accusations of impairment arise from bystander.
Lynn Police Department suggests incident likely due to medical episode; investigation ongoing with bodycam review.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost their season opener 20-13 to the Raiders under new coach Mike Vrabel at Gillette Stadium.
Harold Landry III excelled with 2.5 sacks, showcasing strong pressure against Las Vegas quarterback Geno Smith.
Patriots' running backs struggled, with the team managing only 60 rushing yards on 18 carries in the loss.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys performed at the Seisiún festival in Boston, overcoming a rain delay and evacuation at Suffolk Downs.
The band played a high-energy set, engaging the reduced crowd with songs like 'The Boys Are Back' and 'I'm Shipping Up To Boston'.
Festival attendance suffered due to evacuation, but Saturday tickets were honored for entry on Sunday at Seisiún.

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Bill Belichick banned a team scout from attending UNC practices, citing mutual lack of welcome between facilities.
Belichick's exit from the New England Patriots resulted in a strained relationship, despite initial claims of a mutual parting.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel stated alternative methods will be used to scout UNC players after the scouting ban.

title: 6 takeaways from Patriots’ 20-13 loss to Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots lost their season opener 20-13 to the Raiders after a promising first half collapsed.
Quarterback Drake Maye completed 30 of 46 passes for 287 yards, 1 TD, and 1 INT in the first game.
Free-agent acquisition Harold Landry recorded 2.5 sacks, and Kayshon Boutte caught six passes for 103 yards.

title: Watch: Dropkick Murphys blast Trump, but stump for a longshot New England candidate
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Dropkick Murphys' Ken Casey criticized Donald Trump during their Seisiun festival performance in Boston.
Ken Casey endorsed Graham Platner, a Maine Senate candidate and Marine veteran, opposing GOP Sen. Susan Collins.
Platner, an oyster farmer, aims to invigorate the fight against Trumpism and challenge the Democratic establishment.
